Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Hey, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any emails today?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No? Um... Check your spam folder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! There it is!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... 'Fifty signs your priest might be Michael Jackson.'

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs uncontrollably]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Topical.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am king of forwards. It's how I like to do business, everybody joking around. We're like 'Friends'. I am Chandler and Joey and, uh, Pam is Rachel. And Dwight is Kramer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So the monkey does the sex thing right here! [monkey noises in background]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's funny! That's funny. Not offensive. Uh... because it's nature. Educational.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you want the link because then you could forward it around?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Consider it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... maybe. Maybe. Well, we'll see. Because I... I don't know if it's... [muffled by jacket over his head] Whup! Come on! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: What has two thumbs and likes to bone your Mom? [points at self] This guy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kay! Oh, you are so bad! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [makes laser gun noises]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Boom! Bam! Oh, this guy is out of control! He is a madman! Better get the bleep button ready for him.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: bleep, bleep. What's up, Halpert?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh oh.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Still queer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh oh! Oh-ho-ho-ho-ho-o!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Todd Packer and I are total BFF. Best Friends Forever. He and I came up together as salesmen. One time, we were out and we met this set of twins. And Packer told them that we were brothers. And so, you know, one thing led to another, and we brought em back to the motel. And then Packer did both of them. It was awesome. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh-whoa-oh! Oh! Okay. Grade 'A' gossip for you, right now. Randall, CFO, resigned. Nobody knows why.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? Everyone knows why! You don't know? Okay, check this out. Al lright. So here's the story. So Randall is nailing his secretary, right? And she is totally incompetent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Here we go! Buckle up. It's going to be a bumpy one!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: We're talking blonde incompetent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Like 10 words a minute... talking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, to be fair... blondes, brunettes, you know, there's a lot of dumb people out there.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: They are women, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Wow! I didn't say it! I didn't say it!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I said it. And then, suddenly, for no reason, this bimbo blows the whistle on the whole thing just to be a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow! What did I tell you about the bleep button.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, um... what has two thumbs and hates Todd Packer? [points at self] This guy!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Meant to ask you, can you think you can get someone to drive me around because of the, uh, DUI situation?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Bad boy. [to Ryan] Um... Ryan? [makes Donald Duck noise]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Come on, kid. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! Man. That Todd Packer can do anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Except pass that breathalyzer.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You a big William Hung fan?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Why does everyone ask me that? Who the hell is that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin's Computer
Quote.Text: [monkey noises]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm really excited to meet your Mom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You are?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My Mom is coming in to visit. And she lives like two hours away. And she doesn't have a cell phone... which is cool cause it's kind of adding some suspense to my day. And I keep looking over at the door hoping she'll walk in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've decided to show her around. She really wants to meet everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good. Cause I have a lot of questions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. As a child, did Pam show any traits that would hint towards her future career as a receptionist?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, send me that link to the monkey sex video. I'm going to forward it like it's hot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Forward it like it's hot. Forward it like it's hot. "Old School".

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um... I need to talk to you in your office. It'll just take two seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... literally two seconds?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby is in HR which technically means he works for Corporate. So he's really not a part of our family. Also he's divorced so he's really not a part of his family.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: The full story is that Randall resigned because of sexual harassment. So Corporate asked me to do a five minute review of the Company Sexual Harassment policy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, Toby. No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's really not a big deal, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is a big deal. It's a big deal! What are we supposed to do? Scrutinize every little thing we say and do all day? I mean, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: And then Corporate is going to send in a lawyer...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just to refresh you... .

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: NO!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: on our policy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? He! No! Okay, what is a lawyer going to come in and tell us? To not send out hilarious emails or not tell jokes?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Maybe not some of them. Maybe not inappropriate ones.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is no such thing as an appropriate joke. That's why it's a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone! Hello! Everyone. Hi! Sorry to interrupt. I know you're all busy and the last thing you want is for a major interruption. But Toby has an announcement that he insists on making right now in the middle of the day. [to Toby] So, take it away.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay. Corporate would like us to do a five minute review of the Company Sexual Harassment policy so I'll go over that later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wish you luck, Toby. I really do. But you are going to have a mutiny on your hands and I just can't wait to see how you handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A guy goes to a five dollar... lady of the night and he gets crabs. So, the next day he goes back to complain. And the woman says "Hey. It was only five dollars. What did you expect? Lobster?" This is what's at stake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Time to bring out the big guns. I'm heading down to the warehouse where jokes are born. Find a killer joke that'll just blow everybody away at the seminar later. And remind them what is great about this place. So... ah! Here they are. [to Warehouse guys] Guys! Wondering if I could, uh, get your help for something. I'm looking for a new joke to tell and it needs to be just killer. And it does not need to be clean. So whatcha got?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Like a joke? A knock-knock joke?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, yeah, no, well... I mean better. Better than that. The type of stuff you guys tell all day.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, [points at Michael] those are some awful tight pants you have on. Where'd you get em? Like Queers R Us?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Boys R Us!

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Guy
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, alright. Well, yeah, but, you know... a joke but not necessarily at my expense.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Man, we can see all your business coming around the corner, okay? You need to, you know, hide the... good thing you don't have a lot of business to start with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooh, okay. That was still about me.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So you don't have the biggest package. Don't feel bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't feel bad.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [fake whispers to Roy] I think he feels bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You look like you feel bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Little package!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, not exactly what I was looking for but thanks guys.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guy
Quote.Text: Little package! Little package!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You look good.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hiding from his momma.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guys
Quote.Text: [kissing noises, sheep baaing sounds]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So remember, intent is irrelevant. And that's it. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... I just wanted to say that... Just, my Mom's coming in today.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: MILF!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Usually the day we talk about sexual harassment is the day that everyone harasses me as a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's coming in today and maybe just don't joke around about that stuff in front of her.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Great point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um... in fact, basic rule of thumb, let's just act everyday like Pam's Mom's coming in. All right. That's it. Um... if anybody has any questions about anything, you know where I sit in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, is it over?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I can go over it with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know. It's good. It is not over. It is not over til it's over.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did he tell you everything? Obviously, he didn't because you all still look relatively happy. Albeit bored. Do you realize what we're losing? Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Email forwards.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly! Mmwwah [blows kiss to Angela]! Can we afford to lose email forwards? Do we want that?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I hate them. You send me these filthy emails and you say forward them to ten people or you'll have bad luck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me a break. Umm... Stanley, how about that hot picture you have by your desk? Centerfold in the Catholic schoolgirl's outfit? I mean, it is hot, it is sexy, and it turns him on. And I will admit, best part of my morning is staring at it. But what? Are we just going to take it away?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That is my daughter. She goes to Catholic girls' school. I am taking it down right now.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Um... what about office romance?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Office relationships are never a good idea. Yeah. So let's just try to avoid them. But, um, if you already have one, you should disclose it to HR.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: All relationships? Eh, even a one-night stand?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think the old honor system was just fine. For example, I have never slept with an employee. And, believe me, I could have.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! No! Catherine. Remember her? Remember how hot she was?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She would have definitely slept with me.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She wasn't that hot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, she was. Dammit, Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ok, you know, Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm in an office relationship. It's special. Um... she's nice. She's shy. She's actually here. You want to meet her? Hold on one second. Oh, my God! Put on a shirt! Put on a... . I told you that you'd be on camera. I'm sorry, she's European. No, I told you that you'd be on camera. Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What if Pam was a lesbian? What if she brought her "partner" in to work? [to Toby] Would that be crossing the line?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What if they made out? In front of everybody?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, that would be...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: At home? And I told everybody everything about it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm lost.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, then let's act it out. Pam, you will be girl A and girl B will be... Okay! We'll use the doll. Pam. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Video
Quote.Text: [Crossing the Line: Rules for the Modern Workplace]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wish Todd Packer was here because he would love this. I wonder if anybody else would like to do this. Hey! Um... we have to watch, uh, Toby's video that he's showing us in order to brainwash us and I was wondering if anybody would like to join in? Going to be fun. Got my great pizza. Whataya say? Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, thanks. I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh... my mother's coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she sai [clears throat] Nope, but... Okay. Well, suit yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You said that we could come to you if we had any questions.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where is the clitoris? On a website, it said at the crest of the labia. What does that mean? What does the female vagina look like?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Technically, I am in Human Resources. And Dwight was asking about human anatomy. Um... I'm just sad the public school system failed him so badly.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, maybe when you get really comfortable with each other, you can ask for that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. Good. And...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I should get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Man in Video
Quote.Text: In today's fast-paced business climate, it can sometimes be hard to know when a comment or an action crosses the line. Let's take a look at a couple of scenarios and ask ourselves 'where is the line?'

Quote.Speaker: Video
Quote.Text: [Scenario 1:

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [to cell phone] Yes. Yes, I did. Okay. Well, we can talk about that later then. [to Pam] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you are never going to believe this. The girl in the video we're watching that Corporate gave us... Darryl banged her! Aaand is about 90% sure.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Don't ever let this little bitch drive you around town. We got, uh, lost for half an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't have any DUI's so I can drive myself, but thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Where is Michael Snot? Sniffing some dude's thong? Probably.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you are the lawyer, Mr. O'Malley? I know a lot of lawyer jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. O'Malley
Quote.Text: I love lawyer jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's probably because you don't get 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I said before that I was king of forwards, you got to understand that I don't come up with this stuff. I just forward it along. You wouldn't arrest a guy who's just delivering drugs from one guy to another.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You seem a little bit agitated, Michael. What's the problem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The problem is that I am the boss and apparently I can't say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, that... that's true in a way. You can't say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where's the line? Where's the line, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you need to see the video again, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I've seen the video.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Jan] He talked the whole time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I didn't. [to Jan] Huh, what? [everyone looks up at blow-up doll]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention, everyone! Hello! Ah, yes! I just want you to know that, uh, this is not my decision, but from here on out... we can no longer be friends. And when we talk about things here we must only discuss work-associated things. And, uh, you can consider this my retirement from comedy. And in the future, if I want to say something funny or witty or do an impression, I will no longer, ever, do any of those things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Does that include 'That's What She Said'?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmhmm. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! That is really hard. You really think you can go all day long? Well, you always left me satisfied and smiling, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael. MICHAEL!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, please.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mwah! [kisses hand and salutes office]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: There he is. Good one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You would have done the same. You just didn't think of it first.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mike... Michael. Please. I... I... really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's... That's...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's not my sense of humor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [to man entering office] Hello. [introduces] Jan. Mr. O'Malley. This is my lawyer, James P. Albiny.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Wha...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I believe you may recognize his face from the billboards. He specializes in Free Speech issues.

Quote.Speaker: Albiny
Quote.Text: [to camera] And motorcycle head injuries, worker's comp, and diet pill lawsuits.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This guy does it all.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [to Albiny] 'Scuse me, I'm sorry. [to Michael] Michael. Mr. O'Malley is your lawyer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mr. O'Malley is our Corporate lawyer. We have him on retainer. To protect the company as well as upper level management, such as yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I'm not in trouble?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am so used to being the bad boy. I am so used to fighting Corporate that I forget that I am Corporate. Upper management. They hooked me up with an attorney. To protect me. You can't be too careful about what you say. Mo' money, mo' problems.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, let's get you out of here, James. Um... I think we're under an hour still, so...

Quote.Speaker: Albiny
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I did a lot of paperwork at home before I got here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. We'll talk about it later. Thanks for coming in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Um... hello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [ecstatic] Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Finally made it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love my Mom. Okay. That's probably really the most obvious statement ever.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: This is all yours?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm in charge of this whole area.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Oh, my goodness. That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: So a guy goes home, tells his wife, "Honey. Pack your bags. I just won the lottery." She goes, "Oh my god! That's incredible! Where are we going?" He goes, "I don't know where you're going, just be out of here by five!" [men laugh] Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is where I used to keep my computer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Oh, right! I remember...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But then I moved it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: with the picture.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, but I uh... I switched stuff around because I actually needed like more room for organization. So...

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So this is like, um, an organization station...

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: [to Roy] Oooooh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Well, there he is!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: How are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Hi, handsome!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You look great!

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you! So! We ready for dinner?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you know... actually, I kind of need to stall a bit. But, it's okay, because I am very used to killing time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't believe that.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm going to go wait in the parking lot. And what kind of tunes you want for the ride? Little, uh, classical? Or oldies?

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Oh, anything is fine.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: All right, I'll see ya.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: So which one is Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mom!

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: I just wanted to know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: All right. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then we can go to dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's Mom
Quote.Text: I'll make myself busy.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: There's this guy. He's at a Nymphomaniac Convention. And he is psyched 'cause all these women are smokin' hot perfect 10's, except for this one chick who looks a lot like, uh... [points at Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no. That crosses the line.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Ex-squeeze me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not you. Kevin. Just unwarranted. Hostile work environment, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Packer said it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. You said it. He pointed. A point is not a say. Look. Kevin, we are a family here and Phyllis is a valued member of that family. Like a grandmother.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm the same age as you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know about that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're in the same High School class.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I have a late birthday and usually September's a cut-off point. [to Kevin] You know what? You just crossed the line. Okay? There's a line and you went over it. And you must be punished. So go to your corner.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You mean where my desk is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, your corner. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay. I have a lot of work to do anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmhmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Oh my. They really got to you, didn't they?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They didn't get to me. I got to them. I am still the same old Michael Scott. New and improved. You know what? I love Phyllis. You know what else? I think she is gorgeous. I think she is incredibly, incredibly attractive person. [to Phyllis] C'mere, c'mere, c'mon! Come on! Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooh!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't have to worry. I'm not going to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not worried.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: ...report you to HR.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? The only thing I'm worried about... is getting a boner. Good work today, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Times have changed a little. And even though we're still a family here at Dunder-Mifflin, families grow. And at some point, the daddy can't take a bath with the kids anymore. I am Upper Management. And it would be inappropriate for me to take a bath with Pam. As much as I might want to.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He said what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good morning, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing. You look nice today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You look real thin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't get what you mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You just... You look good. Your shirt looks... You look real good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you said I looked thin, so what does... Does that mean I'm like thin weird or thin handsome or... [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thin handsome, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, well, of course. Of course. [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, Jim, no! Don't drink directly from the can. Okay, I'm serious. It's all over the Internet. They use the same shipping company as a rat poison, and it gets on the can. [Jim takes a drink] Well, you're an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What can I say, Dwight, I live a very dangerous life.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Email chiming] [snickers] Did you see that?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I saw it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You can see her...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's fake.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: She wouldn't do that. She's a Senator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Office romance. For example, Pam and I are dating, do we have to disclose that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not dating.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, but I'm saying hypothetically if we were dating...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not dating, I'm engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Roy is dead, and I ask you out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I would say no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You say yes, and we go out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I would drown myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And now Roy and Pam are dead, and we have your stupid rules to blame, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby actually gets alimony from his ex-wife because she makes more, so that's kind of embarrassing. Not that I'd mind, but it would never happen to me because I would make the marriage work. People seem to like him because they think he's one of us, but he's not. He's this weird loner who just tells people, "Don't do this, don't do that. Hire this person for this reason." I would complain about him, but who would I go to, to complain about Toby? Toby. Bias. And what does he do about that? Nothing. Because he's Toby. What kind of name is that? It's almost a girl's name. I think I've known more girls named Toby than guys. He just kind of makes my skin crawl a little bit. Toby is the devil. Toby's the devil.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know we're having that harassment thing this afternoon.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes when we IM, I send you that little winking face with the lipstick.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I realize that might be harassment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, it is harassment and I'm going to be suing the winking face. I've hired the angry face as my lawyer and you will be hearing from him pretty soon.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. [IM chiming] [laughing]
